More judgment and less box-ticking

Jan 11, 2008

Interesting goings on over the pond as Britain faces a crisis of arts participation:

Sir Brian McMaster's long-awaited assessment of how to encourage excellence in the arts marks a significant change from how it is currently funded and managed. Instead of measuring success through "targetology" and "box-ticking", there should be more judgment, more self-assessment and more input from artists themselves, he says.

IMHO, his proposal may help in the short term but merely stems the tide on what I see as an identity crisis for the arts(more on that theme later).

UPDATE: More on this as Equity and others weigh in
